title: Valuation (geometry)
summary: In geometry, a valuation is a finitely additive function on a collection of admissible subsets of a fixed set X {\displaystyle X} with values in an abelian semigroup. For example, the Lebesgue measure is a valuation on finite unions of convex bodies (that is, non-empty compact convex sets) of Euclidean space R n . {\displaystyle \mathbb {R} ^{n}.} Other examples of valuations  on finite unions of convex bodies are the surface area, the mean width, and the Euler characteristic.
